title: Non-English Speaking
body:
Seriously can we start banning people who refuse to even speak english?

It's pathetic, because they can't even agree to the ToS/EULA/Privacy Policy for our server, so they shouldn't be allowed on our servers in the first place.

I'm sick of running into these people who flat out refuse to speak english, and yet continue speaking in whatever language they use, and it has to stop because this is always happening.

replies.body:
This thread has gotten way out of hand so I'm cleaning it out. Denying someone the right to play a free game because of the language they speak or don't speak is absurd, and discriminatory at it's core. The OP was left up because there was room for good discussion, but just as this behaviour is not tolerated in game it will not be tolerated here on boards.

Not speaking English (or x official language) is NOT ban worthy, and to even suggest such is absurd. Negative behaviour is what dictates punishments, NOT language barriers.

If the discussion can return to civility then I will leave it at this, but if this negativity continues then I will delete any offending comments and lock the thread.

EDIT: And tbh I don't believe deleting posts is exactly a great idea in this instance tbh, since that cuts down discussions in a very bad way and things wouldn't get resolved like this, but rather often it would just go on continuing.

I only deleted the comments that really crossed the "Don't be a Jerk" line, like those that were blatantly racist or were targeting a specific someone. I left as much of the discussion intact as I could without ignoring the rules being broken.
Just edit their thingos to be less jerky then.

The only editing I would do would be to remove lines, but editing gives no notification, and therefore no indication that x content is not allowed, hence deletion rather than edits. If it was an essay post with one jerky line I'd probably just remove the one line, but that hasn't really been the case.
You should have just deleted the whole topic in this case anyway.
There is valid discussion to be had here, which was why I didn't delete the OP in the first place. I didn't want a few bad comments to spoil the rest.

Idk, but I don't believe that the Term of Use states that players have to use English for in-game communication.

Not to mention, it really isn't a big deal anyway. I mean, it's not like we don't know 80-90% of people use the chatlogs merely to joke, troll and flame rather than for anything actually meaningful and constructive for the gameplay itself. What's a bigger deal is when they also don't use/listen to pings altogether, which in that case one could argue it's a refusal to communicate and be reported.

Merely not using English itself does not make the person eligible for reports and bans, as let's be real, nobody is really missing out much if they couldn't understand what another is typing in a match.

Having been on the NA server back in the earlier days of League, where 2-3 languages within a single match is common, I really don't give a shit if someone is typing a language I can not understand (really though, who can be triggered by something they have no idea what it is even about?). I only care whether or not they ping/respond to ping, they play decently or at least try to, and them not being a dickhead.

>YOU HEREBY ACKNOWLEDGE AND AGREE THAT YOU HAVE READ AND UNDERSTAND THE FOREGOING AGREEMENT, AND THAT BY SELECTING THE “ACCEPT” BUTTON OR OTHERWISE USING OR ACCESSING THE RIOT SERVICES, YOU ARE AGREEING TO BE BOUND BY THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS SET FORTH HEREIN.

Now note, this will always spawn in english on the OCE server, and you have to understand what the agreement says (meaning you have to be able to read english.)

I'm sick of seeing discussions in any other language because they can't take it out of league and i'm forced to sit there in a conversation i don't understand.

So yes not being able to read english IS BANNABLE at least on the OCE server.

> not being able to read english IS BANNABLE at least on the OCE server.

No. It isn't.

Your logic is a bit absurd, it's like saying a person is outright illegal to use their own language in a country just because the said country's official language (what they used to write up their laws and such) is another, or that the said person might not be motivated to learn the place's official language itself is illegal and thus should be punished. Since when that's the case? If one has agreed to the terms of some rulebook without understanding what's going on, that simply means they have little ground to argue for anything if shit goes down because they clearly didn't read what is in the rulebook, it however by no means suggest that they are already outlawed because they didn't read it. You're outlawed because you offend the rules, not because you can or can't read them, where did you get the idea the latter is the case? 

Read the ToS's Code of Conduct section, concerning languages there is only statement forbidding offensive chat and spamming etc, the obvious stuff, it mentions not that a person speaking another language qualifies the breach of rules. I mean, are you offended by a person who's merely speaking another language?

As I've said, let's be real no one is missing out anything even if they ignore chat entirely. Secondly, unless there is a total refusal to communicate such as when they also refuse to use and listen to pings, there is no reason to pick on them just because they do not speak the same language as you do, it itself does not constitute an unlawful action.

No one is that gullible. Insult-throwing is a problem, but it is by no means an foreign player exclusive problem.

Secondly, "it's OCE speak english". Imagine you walk down the streets in China, in Thailand, in Japan, in India, or even in Iran. Now a person pops up shouting at you "It's China/Thailand/Japan/India/Iran, speak our official language!" What would you think? Most people would rightfully call them out as being assholes. So why are you coming around doing the same to other people here?

Again, speaking in another language does not constitute a crime, not at all. It's refusal to communicate that does, and it's only so when they also ignore pings mostly to entirely.

No offense, but even i think your logic is absurd.

Expecting communication on OCE server to be english isn't the same as expecting the main communication in a country to be specifically their language.

Most countries a lot of people speak english regardless (or at least enough to get by as a tourist.) whereas if your thinking Australia, i have to pull this from the 2011 Census.

>About 18% of Australians speak a language other than English.

So basically 1/5 people in Australia have a chance of speaking whatever language, and that's spread across all of the langugages taught here.

Honestly i'd put my money on going to any of those countries and having a better bet finding an english speaker then finding people in Australia who speak any given language on OCE.
One problem is that OCE is not only for Australia. There are many other places that use the server.
It is however an english speaking server.

I mention no racism, it's simple courtesy to not force other people into speaking local language, because not everyone has the time to learn every language there is in this world. It's not wrong to ask more tolerance of people.

I have no idea why you have to think virtual places are somehow more rigid than real world. Yeah real world and virtual are different, but it is so that people are everywhere in the virtual world as opposed real world where it's hard limited by cash and other factors; in the online world you only need a computer and internet and off you go. It's precisely that we're handling virtual matters, that we should be more flexible with this kind of thing because I can be accessing a server from half a world away at any time, but I can't do the same irl. It's simply a no-brainer that there will be more "foreign" people on any server than there will be in real life, so why are you lowering the benchmark for the virtual space as oppose to expanding it like we should?

Concerning "You are EXPECTED to speak english", 

* For example in Europe, it's common for people to be exposed to 3 to 4 languages to a certain extent daily, it's extremely common for people to go about be it online or real world within Europe and speak in the languages that don't match with the local official language. Besides a few die-hards, people rarely complain about the massive amount of individual languages being crammed into just Europe itself (especially with EU's migration laws), and they just learn to deal with it, and everyone goes about speaking their language just fine.
* What about places like say China? Where even just within their own borders they have 50 something recognised ethnic groups, 8 major languages, and nearly 300 dialects in total that are still used today across the land? The answer is simple, besides for official and business reasons, no one is forced to use the official language, being Mandarin. Similarly online, no one is forced to type Mandarin either, you either can read or can't read it, assuming it's not against the rules of the forum, server or country. China also rarely places enforcement on other nations to use Mandarin, be it irl or virtual.
* Similarly on say Steam's forums. It's very common for people to start threads in a language that's not English despite the platform's official language being it. Do people complain about it? I haven't seen any. Because people just learn to deal with multiple languages as oppose to rejecting it.
* What about the old NA server, before they'd split out 2 LA servers and BR? I was there, playing games with 3-4 languages per game looking at the "huehuehue" and "jajaja" every game. Do I lose my shit and tell them to type English or gtfo? No, because I learn to deal with it.

**Official language is the suggested common language, it by no means is the 1 and only language, nor is anyone being outlawed, punished or prosecuted for not using it.**

In the case of League, it only ever states that offensive chats, spams, and refusal to communication are outlawed. While one may or may not consider using another language as refusing to communicate, I for one do not, as I only ever considering it so when they also happen to ignore pings entirely.

Rules are applied regardless of whether or not you agreed with or can read them, nor are they ever a part of the factors determining whether or not one is guilty. Rulebooks are statement of boundaries, they never go after people because they don't or can't read them, agree with the rules or otherwise, but only the people that crossed the boundaries; and it's not within both LoL's ToS and any credible nation's laws that using their non-official language or disagreeing with the laws is forbidden, the only thing that's forbidden is offending the stated rules.

I mean, for example, have you read LoL's ToS or better, Australia's laws, word by word? Chances are you didn't, it's a fact that most people don't read Term of Use and laws unless it's work/academia/life related things. If so, aren't you just as "guilty" as those who can't understand it because both of you practically haven't read but "agreed" to the terms? Or is it that the rules are merely written in the language you understand and that suddenly makes it okay, just as if you've actually read it yourself?

Example #2. Do you agree with Iraq's law and happen to be able to read and write say Arabic? If you don't agree and/or aren't able to understand the language, do you suppose say the Iraq law enforcement can immediately arrest you after you've entered their nation merely on the basis that you do not understand their laws and their language or whatever reasonings like that?

Your logic is afaik, very flawed, not to mention very badly biased.
